column5: Sarepta Therapeutics Inc said data from ongoing studies of its lead drug could be enough for the company to apply for a U.S. approval  but that the regulator was unsure if it was enough to fast-track the review process  sparking a sell-off in the company's shares.

column4: Seagate outlook raises concerns about its growth in cloud

column5: July 24 Brokerage and investment bank Raymond James Financial Inc said on Wednesday its quarterly profit rose 10 percent from last year  driven by growth in asset management revenues.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-Earnings misses  gold-miner selloff drag TSX lower
column5: * TSX down 73.08 points  or 0.57 percent  at 12 672.30     * Six of the 10 main index sectors advance     * Gold-mining shares fall with bullion price     * Cenovus  Canadian Pacific drop after results     * Loblaw  Rogers gain after quarterly reports      By John Tilak     TORONTO  July 24 Canada's main stock index fell on Wednesday  hit by disappointing results from Cenovus Energy Inc and Canadian Pacific Railway Ltd as investors processed a flood of earnings reports from the count

column4: UPDATE 2-Profit up  but Canada's Rogers pays price for wireless growth
column5: * Profit  revenue roughly in line with analyst expectations

column4: Canada's Rogers Communications adjusted profit rises 4 pct
column5: July 24 Rogers Communications  Canada's largest wireless phone company and a major cable TV operator  reported a 4 percent rise in its quarterly adjusted net profit as wireless data revenue grew 18 percent.

column4: MOVES-Goldman Sachs  Qatar Holding  Barclays  Royal Bank of Canada
column5: July 24 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Wednesday. To inform us of other job changes  email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column5: July 24 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Wednesday. To inform us of other job changes  email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: BlackRock says executive rejected RBS approach
column5: BlackRock Inc  said its head of Asia Pacific operations  Mark McCombe  spurned an approach regarding the role of chief executive at Royal Bank of Scotland  and will remain with the world's largest fund manager.

column4: CORRECTED-UPDATE 1- BlackRock says executive rejected RBS approach
column5: (Corrects lede to clarify McCombe was not offered RBS CEO job)

column4: RBS fined for reporting flaws worsened by ABN Amro deal
column5: LONDON Britain's Financial Conduct Authority has fined Royal Bank of Scotland 5.6 million pounds ($8.6 million) for failing to report transactions the watchdog needs to help it spot market abuses.

column4: UK watchdog fines RBS bank 5.6 million pounds
column5: LONDON  July 24 Britain's Financial Conduct Authority has fined Royal Bank of Scotland 5.6 million pounds for incorrectly or not reporting at all transactions it made in the wholesale market.

column4: Sanofi  Carlyle in talks to buy Elder Pharma's India formulations business-sources
column5: July 24 Sanofi SA's India unit and Carlyle Group are in separate talks to buy the domestic drug formulations business of India's Elder Pharmaceuticals Ltd  for $400 million-$450 million  three sources with direct knowledge of the matter said.

column4: OfficeMax CFO departs to take same post at Supervalu
column5: OfficeMax Inc  said Wednesday that Chief Financial Officer Bruce Besanko would leave the third-largest U.S. office supply chain next month to take up the same post at supermarket operator Supervalu Inc .

column4: Ameriprise lands adviser in Georgia from Synovus
column5: Ameriprise Financial Inc said Thursday that it has landed Georgia-based adviser Michael Butler from Synovus Financial Corp.

column4: UPDATE 2-Telefonica Brasil profit down on broadband push  weak sales growth
column5: SAO PAULO  July 24 Telefonica Brasil SA  posted a 16 percent drop in quarterly profit on Wednesday  as revenue stagnated while it stepped up sales efforts to stabilize its broadband and pay-TV business.

column4: Telefonica to go back to its homework after German bet
column5: MADRID Fresh from snapping up German mobile operator E-Plus  Spain's Telefonica  will deliver a sharp reminder of challenges closer to home when it publishes first-half results on Thursday.

column4: Telefonica to go back to its homework after German bet
column5: MADRID  July 24 Fresh from snapping up German mobile operator E-Plus  Spain's Telefonica will deliver a sharp reminder of challenges closer to home when it publishes first-half results on Thursday.

column4: Analysis: KPN deal small salve for America Movil losses in Europe
column5: MEXICO CITY Carlos Slim's phone giant America Movil could claw back some paper losses on its KPN stake through the sale of the Dutch company's German business to Telefonica but the move may raise fresh questions about the Mexican's long-term European plans.

column4: Telefonica  KPN deal could be cleared with conditions
column5: BRUSSELS/PARIS Telefonica  is likely to persuade regulators to clear its 8.1 billion euro ($10.7 billion) bid for KPN's  German mobile telecoms business by giving up some spectrum and easing the entry of new competitors  antitrust experts said.

column4: UPDATE 1-Telefonica  KPN deal could be cleared with conditions
column5: * Telefonica-KPN tie-up seen a watershed for European sector

column4: REFILE-Telefonica  KPN deal could be cleared with conditions
column5: * Deal would reduce number of German operators to 3 from 4

column4: UPDATE 1-Thermo Fisher profit edges past Street view; shares up
column5: * Says progressing on Life Tech purchase   (Adds analyst comments  share price)

column4: Thermo Fisher second-quarter profit narrowly beats estimates
column5: Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc  reported a second-quarter profit that was slightly ahead of analysts' expectation  and said it was making progress in planning for its $13.6 billion acquisition of genetic testing company Life Technologies Inc .

column4: Thermo Fisher second-qtr profit narrowly beats estimates
column5: July 24 Thermo Fisher Scientific Inc  reported a second-quarter profit that was slightly ahead of analysts' expectation  and said it was making progress in planning for its $13.6 billion acquisition of genetic testing company Life Technologies Inc.

column4: Visa posts profit of $1.23 bln  authorizes share buyback
column5: July 24 Visa Inc reported a net profit in the third quarter  compared with a loss a year earlier  and the world's largest credit and debit card network authorized a new $1.5 billion share buyback.

column4: Europe to clamp down on charges for paying with plastic
column5: BRUSSELS Banks will have to limit the fees they charge on card payments under proposals from the European Commission on Wednesday that would also scrap surcharges on shoppers paying with plastic.

column4: UPDATE 3-Europe to clamp down on charges for paying with plastic
column5: * Commission outlines rules to cap debit  credit-card fees

column4: EMC profit matches estimates as cloud software unit shines
column5: EMC Corp   the world's largest data storage equipment maker  reported quarterly profit that met analysts' expectations  helped by growth at its cloud software unit  VMware Inc .

column4: EMC profit matches estimates as cloud software unit shines
column5: July 24 EMC Corp  the world's largest data storage equipment maker  reported a quarterly profit that met analysts' expectations  helped by growth at its cloud software unit  VMware Inc.

column4: UPDATE 1-Time Warner Cable  Hulu break off talks-sources
column5: LOS ANGELES  July 24 The owners of video streaming site Hulu called off talks with Time Warner Cable Inc  over the cable operator's plan to take a 25 percent stake after failing to agree on a price  according to two people with knowledge of the negotiations.

column4: International Tower Hill shares slide after Alaska gold mine viability report
column5: Shares of Canadian gold miner International Tower Hill Mines Ltd  plunged 59 percent after the company said a feasibility study found that its only project in Alaska would not be viable at current spot gold prices.
